description: This program connects to AFNI and sends commands that the user specifies interactively or on command line over to AFNI to be executed.

host.title: Host name
host.description: Connect to AFNI running on the specified host using TCP/IP. Default is 'localhost'.

shm.title: Shared memory flag
shm.description: Connect to the current host using shared memory for large data transfers.

port.title: Port number
port.description: Use TCP/IP port number. Default is 8099.

maxwait.title: Max wait time
maxwait.description: Maximum wait time in seconds for AFNI to connect. Default is 9 seconds.

name.title: Plugout name
name.description: Name that AFNI assigns to this plugout. Default is a pre-defined name.

command.title: Commands
command.description: Command to be executed on AFNI. Example: '-com "SET_FUNCTION SomeFunction"'.

quit.title: Quit
quit.description: Quit after executing all -com commands. Default is to wait for more commands.

np.title: Port offset
np.description: Provide a port offset to allow multiple instances of AFNI <--> SUMA, etc., on the same machine.

npq.title: Quiet port offset
npq.description: Like -np but quieter in the face of adversity.

npb.title: Port offset block
npb.description: Similar to -np, but using a block for easier usage.

max_port_bloc.title: Max port block
max_port_bloc.description: Print the current value of MAX_BLOC and exit.

max_port_bloc_quiet.title: Max port block quiet
max_port_bloc_quiet.description: Print MAX_BLOC value and exit quietly.

num_assigned_ports.title: Number of assigned ports
num_assigned_ports.description: Print the number of assigned ports used by AFNI and exit.

num_assigned_ports_quiet.title: Number of assigned ports quiet
num_assigned_ports_quiet.description: Print the number of assigned ports used by AFNI and exit quietly.
